profile_positions.description:
-Responsible for the careful receipt, evaluation, processing, reproduction and dissemination of official court documents both in hard copy and electronic versions within and outside of the Legal Workflow system. I am also responsible for the accurate assignment of registry page numbers to all documents and the correct identification of the appropriate recipients in accordance with the established distribution scheme.
-Focal point for requesting official translations of court records on behalf of the parties and chambers
-Publishing official court documents on the tribunal’s website .
-Produce hard copy and electronic reproductions of official court records and stores them within the authorized repositories of the CMSS vaults and work drives.
-Provide training for Special Project Assistant and interns in different areas to assist the court records office in our day-to-day task. 
-Creating a Provisional Confidential Version of the English, French and Arabic transcript, after receiving them from the official court reporting contractor. 
-Uploading transcripts into Legal Workflow, filling in the data, stamping the transcript and distributing to a restricted distribution list for the confidential transcripts.
-Verifying, by listening to the audio, the Requests for the verification of interpretation and/or transcription submitted by the Chambers and Parties before submitting them to Language Services Section.
-Ensuring that an official and where required, public redacted version of the transcript is made available to the public within the established guidelines.
-Publishing the public version of the Transcript using specialized website software, Joomla. 
- Undertake additional tasks as assigned by supervisor.
profile_positions.title: Court Records Assistant

profile_positions.description:
- Receives, files and disseminates official court records both electronically and in hardcopy.
- Ensures the availability, integrity and confidentiality of the court records in accordance with the established Rules, practices and Procedures.
- Request translations of court documents in accordance with established SOPs and relevant instructions.
- Mantains relevant statistics on the processed court records.
- Processes judicial correspondence in accordance with the defined procedures.
- Maintains the organization of the case and correspondence file in Court management database and manages and organizes the hard copy case and correspondence file in accordance with the relevant instructions.
- Publishes documents on the Tribunal’s website.
- Responds, when required, to external (Chambers, parties/Registry sections) queries for information in relation to the processing of court records an judicial correspondence.
- Receiving, classifying, labeling and archiving all AV materials (FTR, DVDS and DV CAMS) received from AV unit in SCSL Freetown and sub-office in The Hague.
- Performs other ad hoc administrative duties as required.
profile_positions.title: Court Records Assistant/Court Assistant

profile_positions.description:
•Take custody of all original court records and assist in the management of Court Records, Archives, and the dissemination of information.
•Receive service, file and archive all the original documents submitted by parties. This includes, handling of public documents and documents classified as confidential or placed under seal.
•Observe legal procedures in the management and organization of the Court’s files in accordance with the established instructions of the Registry.
•Assign case Numbers to the case files in accordance with the Court’s directives on filing. Uphold the established system for the maintenance and organization of case files. Classify case files and manage official court documents according to their status.
•Receive and process all Court records and audio from the parties.
•Process Court documents for filing; prepare copies of certified documents for distribution to the Trial Chambers, Appeal Chamber and to the parties, taking into account their degree of confidentiality.
•Prepare proof of service (CS2 and CS3) for service of documents on the Trial Chamber, Appeal Chamber, OTP, Defence Counsel and the accused where applicable.
•Filing of original Court documents in the case file and periodically reviewing the case file and periodically reviewing the case files to ensure that they are in good order.
•Maintain the record book, detailed daily record of relevant actions taken to each case, in accordance with the established system and updates the record book as required.
•Implement the established legal Archiving System for all court records.
•Receives guides, assists and provides relevant information to the Court Records Users.
